name: Has framing been signed off and handed over by the main contractor.
Confirm framing layout provides adequate fixing points to be able to meet the required fixing centres.
Confirm appropriate access has been provided.
Confirm GIB Weatherline board is 13mm thick
Note: 2. 41mmx6g Gib Grabber Ceramic Coated High Thread Screws for Timber
Note: 75mm from the corner edge. 200mm on centres for Studs 400mm centres and below. 100mm screw centres for studs more than 400mm centres
Maximum 58mm from the top edge (seismic gap)
Confirm GIB Board that is to be installed is dry.
Confirm Gib Weatherline joint is at the centre of studs and nogs
Screw head is flushed to the surface and not overdriven
Screws minimum 25mm distance to each other
Screws maximum 12 pcs per linear metre
Conform the panels overhang the bottom plate as per drawing
Note: Flush to bottom plate for Levels 1-2
15mm past bottom plate for Ground Floor
Confirm penetrations have been set out as per symonite elevations
Penetrations through GIB is to be constructed in line with Symonite drawing
Confirm main contactor has determined if council inspection is required prior to hand over AND Confirm main contractor has been given opportunity to coordinate council inspection.
Confirm work area clean, tidy and all quality assurance issues resolved in this area.
Confirm main contractor has inspected area prior to hand over.
Confirm written communication stating main contractor has accepted has been received.
